hackathon-description-text: We are pleased to announce that Enflux and Microsoft are organizing a "Future of Sports Technology" hackathon for Developer Week in San Francisco at the Microsoft Reactor in downtown San Francisco the weekend of Feb 17-19.
hackathon-rules:
Our hackathon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of the following.
 
 
We do not tolerate harassment of hackathon participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate at any hackathon venue, this includes the following.
 
Hackathon participants violating these rules 
 from the hackathon 
 (if applicable) at the discretion of the hackathon organisers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 12 month training membership to group classes for the San Francisco location (Franklin & Bush) of Kwan Um Do Kwang, (zensword.org), a "cutting edge" martial arts training gym in San Francisco. Divisible amongst team, or transferable to friends and family.
Free API Access for 12 months or an entry into the Sportradar Acceleradar program.
a. 2 complimentary passes to the LEAN Sports Technology Conference, held by the ISTA in Colorado Springs at One Olympic Plaza March 8-10
a. Free demo space for "Virtual Reality in Sports" at UploadVR
a. Exclusive visit to the U.S. Olympic Elite Athlete Training Center in Chula Vista
a. Post picture on Facebook during Hackathon. Tag #SportsHack2017 #GetEnflux #Bodyarmor
One Free Enflux Suit- voted on by everyone who attends the hackathon

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=680 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
hackathon-location-address: 680 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
hackathon-description-header: This Hackathon brings together the best minds in technology and sports to solve real problems.
